title: Sink not draining
description: The bathroom sink is clogged. It takes 2 hours to drain.

solutions.action: Call a plumber
solutions.outcome: The plumber deftly unclogs the sink. She remarks that the pipes were lined with a glistening, almost-glowing material, but they're in good condition. The clog itself was typical build-up.

solutions.action: Use a plunger and drano
solutions.outcome: After leaving drano in the sink for several hours and coming back to plunge it, you successfully clear the drain. It's still a little slow, but you tell the tenant it will speed up in the next week.

solutions.action: Just use drano
solutions.outcome: You pick up some drano at the hardware store and pour it in the tenant's sink, then leave.

solutions.action: Tell tenant to use drano
solutions.outcome: The tenant acknowledges your text message.

solutions.action: Improvise

title: Tub handle broken
description: The hot water handle on the tub has broken off. It can still be turned, but it is difficult due to the lack of a handle. Could you please put a new handle on the tub?

solutions.action: Replace the entire tub spout
solutions.outcome: The fixture on the tub was pretty old so you aren't able to find an exact replacement, but the new one fits in its place perfectly and it seems to work fine. The tenant thanks you.

solutions.action: Glue a laser pointer in the handle's place
solutions.outcome: This fits perfectly! No one will be able to tell the difference.

title: Window is not sealed
description: The window pane has come out of the frame and is open by about 2 inches at the widest point. Bugs and pests can easily come in.

solutions.action: Hire a contractor to replace the window
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Replace the window
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Remove window from the sill and caulk the pane back in place
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Use tape to cover the opening
solutions.outcome: TODO

title: Washing machine is broken
description: The leftmost washing machine is broken. You can select settings and insert coins, but when you start it it just fills with water but doesn't spin.

solutions.action: Call HappyWash to service the machine
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Put an "Out of Order" sign on the machine
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Tell tenant to call HappyWash to service the machine
solutions.outcome: TODO

title: Slugs
description: Slugs keep crawling into my unit from under the door to the hallway.

solutions.action: Call pest control
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Pour salt on the door threshhold
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Tell tenant to pour salt on the door threshhold
solutions.outcome: TODO

title: Broken window (golfball)
description: A golfball smashed through the window, shattering most of the pane.

solutions.action: Hire a contractor to replace the window pane
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Remove remainder of broken pane and replace it with a new one
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Tape a piece of clear acrylic over the broken window pane
solutions.outcome: TODO

solutions.action: Tell tenant to put cardboard in the window
solutions.outcome: TODO

title: Weird sounds next door
description: For the last several days I've been hearing strange bustling and whistling sounds coming from next door. When I knock, the sound stops, but no one answers. It isn't a human whistling sound.

solutions.action: Investigate the sounds
solutions.outcome: You don't find anything, but you're pretty sure you heard the sounds too and now you're feeling a little uneasy.

solutions.action: Install a white noise machine in the hallway
solutions.outcome: The sounds are still there, but hey, now you can't hear anyone when you run into them in the hallway.

solutions.action: Suggest the tenant record the sounds and create a loop from the sample.
solutions.outcome: The tenant doesn't seem impressed with the suggestion.

title: Lost my key
description: Hello, I have lost my key and am locked out of my unit. Could you please let me back in?

solutions.action: Hire a locksmith to re-key the door
solutions.outcome: You meet the tenant at their door, verify their identity, then call a locksmith to re-key the lock. You keep a copy of the key just in case this tenant locks themself out again.

solutions.action: Look for a copy of their key
solutions.outcome: You spend half the day looking for keys, but cannot find a backup of the tenant's key

solutions.action: Hire a teacher who can help you to 'unlock anything in your life'
solutions.outcome: While the course was interesting and you have a lot to think about, you realize at the end that you're not any closer to being able to unlock any door in the building.

solutions.action: Break down the door
solutions.outcome: You break down the door. The tenant doesn't seem that grateful they're able to get into their unit, but on the positive side, you decide to replace the door, including the lock.

title: Refrigerator eating my food
description: For weeks I have been hearing strange sounds from the kitchen, like plastic mashing together, with growling and grunting and gurgling. It was happening again at 4am today and I went into the kitchen without turning the light on, and that's when I realized that the fridge is eating my food. It also explains why my groceries go so fast...

solutions.action: Tell the tenant to go out to eat for a few weeks to starve the fridge
solutions.outcome: The tenant is reluctant at first, but agrees after learning that their renter's insurance covers the food loss and meals out. They stop bringing groceries home and eventually the refrigerator quiets down.

solutions.action: Replace the refrigerator
solutions.outcome: Moving the fridge out of the unit is more difficult than you recall it having been in the past. It's heavier and feels ... reluctant, somehow. You hear it gurgling sadly as you put it in the storage closet.

solutions.action: Try baiting the fridge with cheese
solutions.outcome: The cheese disappears by the next day, but nothing else changes.

solutions.action: Observe the fridge until it eats again
solutions.outcome: After 3 days of occasional low grumbles and growls emanating from the fridge, it finally happens: the plastic mashing builds up, getting louder and louder. You open the door. Half-eaten food and liquid oozes onto the floor. The fridgewhines.

title: No electricity in kitchen
description: When I got home I discovered that my kitchen has no power. The refrigerator, range, and microwave are all dead, and the outlet I usually have my electric kettle plugged into also does not work.

solutions.action: Hire an electrician
solutions.outcome: The electrician finds the reversed polarity quickly and re-grounds wires in the master outlet for the kitchen before replacing the outlet itself.

solutions.action: Try to fix the electrical issue yourself
solutions.outcome: You try replacing the outlet and it works briefly before melting the cable you plugged into it. After a day and some googling you figure out the polarity is reversed and try fixing it. It seems okay.

solutions.action: Plaster off the kitchen
solutions.outcome: You provide the tenant a mini-fridge and portable range before starting your work. Bewildered, they argue with you, but you're preoccupied with building up the plaster wall and ignore them.

title: Window stuck open (rain)
description: Hi, I opened my window and can't seem to shut it. It's starting to rain, so this is kind of urgent. Thanks.

solutions.action: Go over to shut the window yourself
solutions.outcome: With effort, you're able to shut the window. The apartment reeks though, and you almost want to reopen the window, just a tiny bit...

solutions.action: Send another tenant you think is stronger to shut the window
solutions.outcome: You don't hear back from either tenant. It's probably fine.

title: No warm water
description: There is no warm water in my apartment, either coming from the kitchen skin or from either faucet in the bathroom.

solutions.action: Check the water heater
solutions.outcome: Looks like someone turned the upper temperature on the heater down by 30%. You turn it back up.

solutions.action: Suggest the tenant use an electric kettle
solutions.outcome: The tenant sends you an angry text message. Maybe they don't have a kettle?

title: Silkworms
description: Silkworms have been getting into my apartment! I think they're getting in through a crack in the wall. It's so gross.

solutions.action: Gift the tenant a potted mulberry tree for their new pets
solutions.outcome: As you hand the tenant the mulberry tree, you explain that mulberry leaves are the main thing that silkworms eat. It is important to keep your silkworms hydrated.

solutions.action: Plaster the crack in the wall
solutions.outcome: The crack in the wall turns out to be a 5-inch gap. The tenant is lucky they aren't getting bats or something. You plaster it shut as best you can.

solutions.action: Collect the silkworms from the unit
solutions.outcome: One by one, you pluck up the silkworms from the unit, collectin them in a small wicker basket. Some of them climb out, but you coax them back in with mulberry leaves. You thank the tenant when you leave.
